definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known

sentences.english: Commercial press-release distribution services are also used to distribute news releases.
sentences.chinese: 商业新闻发布分销服务也被用来散布新闻稿。

sentences.english: Stars create these elements and spew them into space.
sentences.chinese: 恒星产生这些元素并将其散布到太空中。

sentences.english: A string of tiny islands scattered off the Croatian coast are up for sale.
sentences.chinese: 一群散布在克罗地亚沿海的小岛正在出售中。

sentences.english: The error estimates for scattered data interpolants on spheres are discussed.
sentences.chinese: 讨论球面上散布数据点插值的误差估计问题。

sentences.english: Coffee retailer becomes latest food and beverage company to spread the wealth to investors.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡零售商最近成为散布投资者财富的餐饮公司。

sentences.english: Spread his word for non-believers left on earth.
sentences.chinese: 散布他的言词，使得非信徒离开地球。

sentences.english: the gossiper mates with the man herself.
sentences.chinese: 散布谣言的人自己就可以跟那个男人交配。

sentences.english: Opposite the islet, the beach consisted first of sand, covered with black stones, which were now appearing little by little above the retreating tide.
sentences.chinese: 小岛对面海滩的最低层是沙砾，上面散布着黑石头。

sentences.english: Several Chinese dairies are suspected of negligence in allowing the distribution of tainted milk products.
sentences.chinese: 几个中国牛奶场被怀疑在有毒乳制品散布上的有疏漏。

sentences.english: Besides computers, film and TV also spread vicious information.
sentences.chinese: 除了电脑，电影电视也在散布不良信息。

sentences.english: Rickety metal tables dotted the treed square.
sentences.chinese: 佝偻的金属桌子散布在有树的广场。

sentences.english: On the east side of the building, there is a promenade with an old growth poplar forest which acts as a windbreaker.
sentences.chinese: 在建筑的东边，由散布的原始白杨林充当防护林。

sentences.english: Small tan sesame seed-sized lice are seen scattered amongst the hairs of the head.
sentences.chinese: 芝麻大小黝黑小虱在头发中散布。

sentences.english: A fifty-six-year-old woman accused of spreading rumors.
sentences.chinese: 一位五十六岁的老妇人，罪名是散布谣言。

sentences.english: The tissue can effectively block the spread of droplets containing germs.
sentences.chinese: 面纸可有效阻隔含菌小水珠的散布。

definition: to cover the whole (area)/to be found throughout
to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up
to cover up/to conceal/to go into hiding
to roam all over the place/to go into every nook and corner/to infiltrate/(of criminals, enemies etc) to be on the run/to flee and try to hide
to hide/to go into hiding/to take refuge
to conceal oneself/to go into hiding/to take cover
